1:
Why are times for judging wicked people not set by the Almighty?
\q Why do not those who are faithful to God see his days of judgment come?
4:
They force needy people out of their path;
\q poor people of the earth all hide themselves from them.
5:
See, these poor people go out to their work
\q like wild donkeys in the wilderness, looking carefully for food;
\q perhaps the Arabah will provide them food for their children.
\q
7:
They lie naked all night without clothing;
\q they have no covering in the cold.
9:
There are wicked people who pluck orphans from their mothers' breast,
\q and wicked people who take children as security from poor people.
\q
10:
But the poor people go about naked without clothing;
\q although they go hungry, they carry others' sheaves of grain.
12:
In the city people groan;
\q the wounded people cry out,
\q but God pays no attention to their prayers.
\m
13:
Some of these wicked people rebel against the light;
\q they know not its ways,
\q nor do they stay in its paths.
\q
15:
Also, the eye of the adulterer waits for the twilight;
\q he says, 'No eye will see me.'
\q He disguises his face.
\q
19:
As drought and heat melt away the snow into waters, 
\q so Sheol takes away those who have sinned.
21:
The wicked one devours the barren women who have not borne children;
\q he does no good to the widow.
23:
God allows them to think they are secure, and they are happy about that,
\q but his eyes are on their ways.
25:
If it is not so, who can prove me to be a liar;
\q who can make my speech worth nothing?"
